questions.description: Which of the following represents the action of insulin

options.description: increases blood glucose levels by hydrolysis of glycogen.
increases blood glucose levels by stimulating glycogen production
decreases blood glucose levels by forming glycogen
increases blood glucose levels by promoting cellular uptake of glucose

questions.description: Which of the following statement is correct in relation to the endocrine system

options.description: Adenohypophysis is under direct neural regulation of the hypothalamus
Organs in the body like gastrointestinal tract, heart, kidney and liver do not produce any hormones
Non-nutrient chemicals produced by the body in trace amount that act as intercellular messenger are known as hormones
Releasing and inhibitory hormones are produced by the pituitary gland

questions.description: Identify the hormone with its correct matching  of source and function:

options.description: Oxytocin posterior pituitary, growth and maintenance of mammary glands
Melatonin pineal gland, regulates the normal rhythm of sleepwake cycle
Progesterone - corpus luteum, stimulation of growth and activities of female secondary sex organs.
Atrial natriuretic factor ventricular wall increases the blood pressure

questions.description: Fight or flight reactions cause activation of:

options.description: the parathyroid glands, leading to increased metabolic rate.
the kidney, leading to suppression of renin- angiotensin- aldosterone path way.
the adrenal medulla, leading to increased secretion of epinephrine and norepinephrine.
the pancreas leading to a reduction in the blood sugar levels.

questions.description: A chemical signals that has both endocrine and neural roles is:
Which one of the following hormones is not involved in sugar metabolism?
Which one of the following hormones though synthesised else where, is stored and released by the master gland ?
Which of the following pairs of hormones are not antagonistic (having opposite effects) to each other
Changes in GnRH pulse frequency in females is controlled by circulating levels of:
Select the incorrect statement:

options.description: LH and FSH decrease gradually during the follicular phase
LH triggers secretion of androgens from the leydig cells
FSH stimulates the sertoli cells which help in spermiogenesis

questions.description: The amino acid Tryptophan is the precursor for the synthesis of:
Graves' disease is caused due to:
The posterior pituitary gland is not a 'true' endocrine gland because:

options.description: it only stores and releases hormones
it is under the regulation of hypo-thalamus
it is provided with a duct

questions.description: A temporary endocrine gland in the human body is:
Hypersecretion of GH in adults does not cause further increase in height, because

options.description: Bones loose their sensitivity to growth hormone in adults.
Muscle fibres do not grow in size after birth
Growth hormone becomes inactive in adults

questions.description: GnRH, a hypothalamic hormone, needed in reproduction, acts on

options.description: anterior pituitary gland and stimulates secretion of LH and FSH
posterior pituitary gland and stimulates secretion of oxytocin and FSH.
posterior pituitary gland and stimulates secretion of LH and relaxin
anterior pituitary gland and stimulates secretion of LH and oxytocin

questions.description: Which of the following is an amino acid derived hormone ?
Which of the following hormones can play a significant role in osteoporosis?
How does steroid hormone infulence the cellular activites ?

options.description: Activating cyclic AMP located on the cell membrane.
Using aquaporin channels as second messenger
Changing the permeability of the cell membrane
Binding to DNA and forming a gene-hormone complex

questions.description: Select the correct statement:

options.description: Insulin acts on pancreatic cells and adipocytes

questions.description: Select the answer which correctly matches the endocrine gland with the hormone it secretes and its function/deficiency symptom :

Norepinephrine :
(a) is released by sympathetic fibres
(b) is released by parasympathetic fibres
(c) increases the heart rate
(d) decreases blood pressure
Which of the above said statements are correct :

Match the following hormones with the respective disease :
(a) Insulin
(b) Thyroxin
(c) Corticoids
(d) Growth Hormone
(i) Addison's disease
(ii) Diabetes insipidus
(iii) Acromegaly
(iv) Goitre
(v) Diabetes mellitus
Select the correct option.

Match the following columns and select the correct option:
Column-I
(a) Pituitary gland
(b) Thyroid gland
(c) Adrenal gland
(d) Pancreas
Column-II
(i) Grave's disease
(ii) Diabetes mellitus
(iii) Diabetes insipidus
(iv) Addison's disease

Which of the following are not the effects of Parathyroid hormone?
(a) Stimulates the process of bone resorption
(b) Decreases Ca2+ level in blood
(c) Reabsorption of Ca2+ by renal tubules
(d) Decreases the absorption of Ca2+ from digested food
(e) Increases metabolism of carbohydrated
Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).
Assertion (A): FSH which interacts with membrane bound receptors does not enter the target cell.
Reason (R): Binding of FSH to its receptors generates second messenger (cyclic AMP) for its biochemical and physiological responses.
In the light to the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.description: (A) is correct but (R) is not correct
(A) is not correct but (R) is correct
Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the Correct explanation of (A)

questions.description:
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).
Assertion (A): During pregnancy the level of thyroxine is increased in the maternal blood.
Reason (R): Pregnancy is characterised by metabolic changes in the mother.
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.description: (A) is correct but (R) is not correct
(A) is not correct but (R) is correct
Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
Both (A) and (R) are correct but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)

questions.description:
Select the correct statements.
(a) Angiotensin II activates the cortex of adrenal gland to release aldosterone.
(b) Aldosterone leads to increase in blood pressure.
(c) ANF acts as a check on renin-angiotensin mechanism.
(d) ADH causes vasodilation.
(e) Vasopressin is released from adenohypophysis.

A. Maintenance of water and electrolyte balance 
B. Regulation of base metabolic rate 
C. Normal rhythm of sleep-wake cycle 
D. Development of immune system 
E. Support the process of R.B.Cs formation
